definitions.definition: The political ideology attributed to the governments of British prime minister Margaret Thatcher (1979–1990), characterised by, among other things, a free market economy, privatisation , low taxation , austerity and opposition to unionisation .

main_definition: ( UK politics ) The political ideology attributed to the governments of British prime minister Margaret Thatcher (1979–1990), characterised by, among other things, a free market economy, privatisation , low taxation , austerity and opposition to unionisation .
